Reviews.Title: “near aljunied mrt station”
Reviews.Author: sexyhoney
Reviews.Content: fragrance hotel ruby is near in aljunied mrt station its just 15-20 minutes walk there is 7-11 many hawker center nearby..many girls hanging around night and day but they will not bother you so safe walking even late at night and early in the morning as early as 2am....our room were cleaned everyday our bedsheet towel was change everyday also the coffe and the water...we probably come back on this hotel with kids..thanks for the accomodation which i expect that everything is gonna be worst but its not..

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever... and we've stayed in some!”
Reviews.Author: TheBoysNottingham
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in budget accomodation in singapore before so wern't expecting alot, but this is the worst. The plus sides the sheets were clean. the negitive sides, the place was dirty, from the floor to the walls and windows didnt open, there was nowhere to unpack and not enoudh room to leave a case open and walk past it. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Near the train station but room is very dusty and small”
Reviews.Author: leydelossantos
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location in terms of its nearness to the train station at Al Juneid with walking distance of about 10-15 minutes. Although during the day and specially at night, you're gonna see a lot of ladies hanging by the street since the location is in Singapore's Red Light District which is Geylang. The room is really small with no space to open up your luggage. It is also covered in dust and cockroaches which was unexpected from Singapore's standards in terms of their cleanliness. I would suggest to stay at a more value-packed hotel rather than this cheap one if you are particular with the rooms that you's re sleeping on. But, if you treat your hotel as only a place to put and leave your bags, have a quick nap then leave, probably this hotel could be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER visit again.”
Reviews.Author: anon_banana
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its great price (hard to find in a place as expensive as Singapore) and figured that since we were only staying two nights - how bad could it be? This is possibly the worst hotel experience I have ever had, and I have stayed in a lot of budget hotels and hostels. As soon as we got into a cab, the driver was concerned that we were staying in the Red Light District (however, Singapore is a very safe city overall, and we never felt threatened around the hotel). You can tell at once that it is definitely not one of the more desirable neighbourhoods. Service at the front desk is pretty much non-existent. As soon as we stepped off the elevator and into the hallway, all we could smell was smoke - this continued into our hotel room. Very small sized room, however consistent with most Asian budget hotels. Beds are extremely hard because there isn't a real mattress. There is an ensuite bathroom with mold in the tiles. We were prepared to work through all of those problems (again, just two nights, right?) but the absolute worst part of the hotel is that you can't get any sleep. There is no insulation in the walls and every time a door opens/closes, you can hear it from your room like it was your own door opening. There were people coming and going (and screaming) at all hours of the night, for both nights that we were there. Redeeming qualities: 1. you can borrow travel adaptors from the front desk for a refundable deposit; 2. the hotel is a 5-minute walk away from a subway station, or a relatively short cab ride away from the Marina Bay

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: Angelia L
Reviews.Content: My friend from Malaysia, check-in afternoon of 5 mar 2012, Dirty toilet dirty floor and cockroaches around !!! Door lock was spoil need to use force to open the door.. On the 2nd day morning, told the reception to have the room clean since he is going out of the room, back late afternoon the room was still unclean, had to wait in lobby for room to be cleaned. Even after housekeeping floor of room are still dirty with dust.. had to request to be mop.. a very bad experience and disappointed.. Alot of hotel booking websites had already alot bad reviews of this hotel but despite that we still go ahead of booking this. Thinking some reviews might not be true.. But seeing is believing !! I hope the management can do something about their rooms after all we still pay for the room we stay it not free ! So the minimum cleaning standard should be there... only pro : cheap near alot halal food.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, not clean”
Reviews.Author: Maziarsh
Reviews.Content: Let say it short and sharp: 1- Location: Good for singles looking for FUN. not good for families and business mans. 2- Rooms: Small (but expected), and not clean. bed sheets had many burns from cigars ashes. 3- Staff were helpful. 4- LRT station near (7-8 walk) and bus stations also near. 5- price: I don't know but if there are other hotel with the same price, better to try them. 6- low levels facing the street are not good if you want to sleep at night. also you can hear the other people in the other rooms and corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient for our needs”
Reviews.Author: OLS_LTB
Reviews.Content: As most travelers have commented, the room was quite small, this was expected but this is the smallest hotel room we have ever been in. There was no place to open your luggage, you'll have to use the bed. We had a small table with a water heater to make coffee. The room was made up everyday we were there and supplies such as coffee and tissue paper was replenished every time. The reception was okay enough but they should put more effort if we make inquiries. The hotel is in the red light district of SIngapore and as such even in the middle of the day we passed by women plying their trade. In the evening men congregated near the hotel waiting for the ladies coming out from the building in front of the hotel. We weren't harassed though just the occasional hand gestures by the women as I passed by asking if I needed their services. There are a lot of food establishments and stores to buy supplies from. The bus stop is around the corner and the MRT station about 10 minutes away on foot so you can easily access the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality is an alien concept here.”
Reviews.Author: maddoghere4d
Reviews.Content: Amateurs! Anything but Fragrant. I’d like to meet the owners face to face and tell them exactly what I think of their miserable little chain and in particular the Ruby since Tripadvisor protocols would deem my language too offensive to publish. DO NOT bring your family here. I have stayed in worse hotels of the cockroach variety but at least they charge cockroach prices. This hotel with its pretentious lobby and often surly staff, set as it is in the heart. of the red light district, seems reasonably priced at first - think again. Let’s start with wifi. What a joke! It’s 5 SG Dollars (£2.50) for 2 hours. It seldom works so you have to trek back to the lobby to get them to ‘reset ‘it - if in fact they do anything at all. “It’s not our fault, it’s the system” they explain. Next day…apparently I should have logged in immediately even though in theory I could log on anytime in the next 24 hours. If I log out at any time, that’s it - another payment to get back in and on the saga goes. I went overboard with niceness to see if that would help, calling staff by name, greeting pleasantly, “how are you today “ all that stuff - still no effective wifi. Forget wifi here, there’s plenty downtown that’s free. My depressing little corner room was a rhapsody in faded peach and scuff marks with the luxury of a light bulb to read by or if I preferred, a centrally placed interrogation light should I feel an urge to confess something. Mercifully they’d been thoughtful enough to spare me their taste in art and left the walls as a blank canvas for me to savour the ‘open narrative’ as the critics call it. The corridors teem at night, the clanking doors echo and for a moment as the Alpha waves kick in, it’s possible to confuse the sounds with what you imagine death row to be like. The street noise outside is to be expected - I have earplugs - and the view I won’t go into for the sake of decency even though I’m a man of the world and expect to see what I see. The Bed: Assuming you managed to sleep at all, getting up can be a novel experience. You discover who is the dominant partner in your relationship as they will have won the battle for the pitifully small sheet. That leaves you stuck to a vinyl mattress which you have to gingerly peel yourself off like removing some giant bandaid. The bathroom: ha ha ha! There’s a loo shoved up against a corner wall which you have to ride side saddle like Igor or Richard the Third. Once hunched, you have time to consider the grouting that needs doing or perhaps contemplate whether bleach would be a good idea for the grey scum of the floor tiles and to hell with the environment and what line of white washbasin sealant wouldn’t be without its splodges of mould? The shower head points at the junction of wall and ceiling so that getting water down to your level involves vigorous practice of your Mexican wave technique lest you go about Singapore all day in a soapy wax. The TV - forget it. The hair dryer - nice to look at, if only it worked. I found that if I got my wife to stand under the air-con whilst I hummed a buzzy noise and flounced around her ala Warren Beatty in ‘Shampoo’, it not only made up for the shortcomings of the dryer but entertained in a way the TV could not. Security. The hotel’s notion of security is more a kind of leap of faith, a testament to the clientele and inhabitants honesty. Placing my laptop in the staff’s tender care, I was overjoyed when I returned early evening to see it sat there on the floor behind the desk, not a member of staff insight. At least it was still their, silly me for ever doubting. Here’s the really stupid part - I stayed three nights in the hope things might improve. One night would be too much. I bet the owners don’t live like this. On the plus side…? Geyling is vibrant and cheap to eat and close to the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Even closer to the MRT than the last hotel I stayed at on my last trip to Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff206
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my very first trip to Singapore way back at the end of 2009 and out of the best possible price I found for the somewhat unexpected trip I had to take just last week, this was one of the best priced hotels. Not only was it fairly close to where I had stayed the last time (Geylang area), but what I hadn't realized was that Fragrance Ruby was even closer to the MRT than then previous hotel! In comparison to the last hotel I stayed at, the walk to the MRT was only about 10 minutes and very easy to get to. The hotel is very decent too and really have no complaints other than part of the ceiling looked a little mildewy or perhaps had a small water issue some time back and this was the result of what happened afterward. Anyways, aside from that small discrepancy, I thought the hotel did it's justice and would certainly stay there again should I need to go back to Singapore again in the future! As others have mentioned though, yes it is in the red light area so one will probably see a number of girls hanging around on some of the streets nearby but other than that there's also a 7 Eleven close by for those late night runs to the store to grab a snack. Also, for dinner, there's PLENTY of food stalls all along Geylang Rd. and even up on Sims Rd. (where the MRT is adjacent to). They have lots and lots of selections and very good prices so go enjoy the food near this hotel location as well! All in all, a decent place to stay, nice room, and good restaurants nearby too. Oh and also, if one ever plans on checking out, but wants to leave their belongings at the hotel to retrieve at a later time, the hotel has a "Luggage Room" in which travelers can leave their things in and pick up at a later time (at no charge of course:) * The best places to view rooms for this hotel I would say, is by using one of two websites either agoda.com or asiarooms.com

Reviews.Title: “Red Light But Alright!”
Reviews.Author: manilagirl83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a red light district so don't be surprised if you're a guy and a girl offers you some "service". But the amenities are very basic, the room's small, there's cold/ hot shower, cable TV, a soft bed. The front staff are friendly and very fast, had no delays in check in or checkout. If you're just looking for a place to rest your head after a whole day of frolicking in SG, this is an option.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap tiny room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Janet T
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely small, but had essentials, and was clean. The reception staff were always helpful and busy, and happy to store baggage after checkout. The worst part was the location immediately next to and surrounded on all sides by brothels and streetwalkers and clients, however the women and girls seemed relaxed and the clients seemed preoccupied if predatory. The staff of the local restaurants and shops were friendly and efficient, and the food and shopping was cheap. The hotel is just a few blocks from a train station only a few minutes from the centre of Singapore and on the line to the airport also. The footpaths are a nightmare, with open smelly drains dangerously close, and steps and level changes to contend with which is difficult with a wheeled suitcase. A walk on the wild side, and an interesting experience in the heart of a slick city.

Reviews.Title: “I would avoid!”
Reviews.Author: student415
Reviews.Content: I booked this place for one night because I needed a place to stay before moving in to a new apt. The price may be cheap compared to other hotels but expensive in my opinion if you consider the quality of the hotel. My room looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. There also happened to be a ridiculous amount of noise from outside and from the floor I was staying on which made it nearly impossible for me to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A poor hotel in the middle of Red Light District”
Reviews.Author: tomasztomczuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location during summer, at first booked this hotel for several days, but after two nights decided to leave for a hostel location. The hotel is in the Red Light District of Singapore - do not worry, as I felt very safe walking around the area even at night. I was warmly welcomed upon entering the hotel and check-in, got my room which was at the top floor. The area around the front desk, elevators and the corridors were well maintained by the stuff. I was only questioned with signs around the hotel "do not spit", I was later on instructed by the front desk that majority of their guests are from India - and those people would sometimes spit all around them. The rooms are tiny, it was impossible to open a lauggage on the ground, you would have to place it on bed, there is a desk and chair and a hunging tv screen - I did not use it. The bathroom is a joke, the sliding door make it impossible to close them correctly, there was always a hole in between the wall. Upon using the shower, the water would splash everywhere it could, but you. What is good about the hotel is that it is cheap and if you are hungry at night there are a lot of low-range priced restaurants and a 24/7 7eleven store.

Reviews.Title: “Very tiny room”
Reviews.Author: The J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in a single room at the corner of the building. Theyreally offered a room with a single bed for one pax only. This hotel was close to aljunied mrt station. There are convinence store and food stall just at the corner of the street. Its not five star clean, but for me its acceptable enough. For those who stays in 5 stars hotel, i wouldnt recommend this. The location is in the red light district area. So if you cant stand crowd until late night, especially during weekend, better not choose to stay in this area. The bathroom layout however was too small. The shower drop just in front of the toilet seats, which give you no room to turn around your body during shower, not to mention the position of the light was also not spread evenly. Although they provide hair dryer in the room, which was quite good in my opinion for hotel class like this.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest & dirtiest room I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: papaija2008
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here a few weeks ago. To say it briefly; the room was the smallest and dirtiest I have ever seen. If there's a hair in the sink or at the bed, I don't freak out or call the hotel manager right away, but this room was soo dirty.. Luckily I was traveling alone because there wouldn't have been enough space in the room for luggage for two people. The hotel is located on a street where prostitutes hang out. I was left alone even though I was alone, but if you're disturbed just by the fact that the prostitutes are there, this hotel (and area in general) is not for you. Aljunied MRT station is about 10 mins. walk away and there's lots of restaurants nearby. The Hotel 81 Gold next door is a bit better option. The rooms there are small too but atleast my room was cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Budget traveler looking for a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: genxjay
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 days 3 nights. Rooms were relatively small and dirty. You can feel the stickiness of the floor the moment you step on it barefooted. Some rooms come with a tiny little wardrobe but some don't. They do provide daily housekeeping with drinking waters and coffee replenished. Bed are not too comfortable as they have the plastic sheet which will annoy you when you're sleeping on the bed. You can easily hunt for food around that area by walking. Most of the eating place are open until at least 3am. Though it is a red light district, they do not disturb offering services which look like they're harassing you. Convenience store are available within walking distance and is 24hours open. You may also easily catch a cab to town or elsewhere. Not recommended for a single lady traveler as it could be a little secluded when you're walking out the street.

Reviews.Title: “Just for emergency, shoe box room, 68SGD!”
Reviews.Author: joemarselo
Reviews.Content: as the title, just enough when you have emergency situation and need a bed to rest your body. the room size is tiny, a shoe box size. priced at 68 SGD, in red district area in Singapore ... you can imagine ...

Reviews.Title: “great value - really all you need”
Reviews.Author: yeshekathy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through booking.com and it was very reasonable (cheaper than through the hotel itself) and was very happy with it. It is basic (what can you expect for AUD$40) but had all I needed - cold aircon, hot water, reasonably clean rooms, quiet too. Best was the position. Bus at the end of the road, train 5 minutes away, cheap food all around... yes there are girls lining the street but even as a single woman coming home very late sometimes I never felt at all uncomfortable... it is Singapore after all. Only negative for me was the expensive wifi - in a modern city like Singapore I would expect it to be free everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean bed, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: menamo
Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel with all amenities. Room pretty small but well maintained and clean. 10 min walk to MRT station. Might consider other sister hotel closer to MRT next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “This is hotel for animals, not for humans.”
Reviews.Author: HelsinkiKooS Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely worst hotel where I have been! How you can even find this kind of rathole from country like Singapore. It was dirty, and in toilet we found humanhair. You can see from pics how dirty it was. Also door to corridor were so thin that when someone talked there you woke up like 5 in the morning. Matress was made of plastic. We had to take vodkadrink to be there few hours before we went to next hotel. We had to be in this discusting place 2 nights, cause it was new year and all hotels were full. We paid 50€ for tinyest room I have ever seen. But I think hotel should paid for us, or anyone who just accidently goes there. Dont go, if you have pets, you can put them to this hotel, but this is not for humans. Hotel is middle of red light area, and that didint bother at all after you saw room and toilet in this hotel. We also needed to put SHOES ON when we went to toilet, it was so awful.

Reviews.Title: “Old and run-down”
Reviews.Author: Fiver75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fragrance Hotel Ruby when transiting through Singapore. While it remains one of the only reasonably priced hotels in Singapore, you certainly get what you pay for. The Geylang area is bustling, with lots of great food to be found and people around at all hours, but the 24 hours hubbub out the window can be annoying - hope to get a room high up in the building. The rooms are very basic and very small. They are showing their age and look very heavily used. Bed sheets were stained, and I was glad I was only staying there one night. There was a kettle, cups and some complimentary water and coffee included though, which was nice. My window latch was broken, so I couldn't close it properly, which was an issue both for noise (overnight) and heat (during the day) as the old battle-axe of an air-conditioner could only do so much to cool the room. For a cheap bed to sleep for a night, Fragrance Ruby is okay, but any more than that it is not. Recommended, if only for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy. Worst night sleep in my life”
Reviews.Author: JaimeA91
Reviews.Content: me and my partner booked this hotel as a budget somewhere to stay so we could spend more on enjoying singapore.. if your thinking of doing the same thing, dont. We arrived to be told we couldnt check in til 3, so we went out and arrived back at the hotel at 10pm, when we arrived there were builders ripping down parts of the ceiling in the front reception. They was rubble and dust everywhere. We went up to our room to find dirty bed sheets so we took them off and tried to sleep without until we realised it was the actual 'air bed' that smelt like a wet dog. The bathroom was small and unhygenic. We went downt to reception to complain. They were nice receptionist and they give us a new room on the third floor. As we were walking up to our room we noticed all the men taking prostitutes back to their rooms... when we got to our room the receptionist apologised as the sheets were dirty in this room aswell. So she went down to get us new ones. the air bed didnt smell quite as bad as the other one but still had a smell. The windows had no handles so they were permantley open and the bathroom was again dirty with a just a shower head in the cornor of the room, no basin or curtain and you had to dodge between the sink and the toliet to stand under it. The hotel was located in a back street 'red light district' where the locals were rude and the area was dirty and full of rubbish. All the local men were trying to look down my top and the local women were smiling at my partner. We are only very young not even 20 yet and thought we could handle sleeping it rough... but this was just one step too far. Dont take your kids there or anyone for that matter. We swapped hotels after the first night to a much nicer hotel just off orchard road. Little more a night but its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Economical for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: drKSG
Reviews.Content: I was flying in from San Francisco on United Airlines to Singapore, and my final destination was Malaysia by express bus at Golden Mile Complex near the Kallang MRT. My flight arrived after midnight so I needed a layover stay. I looked up via Google Map on a location within walking distance from MRTs and a economical hotel. So I settled for the Fragrance chain at the Ruby booked through Booking.com using credit card at SD 65 per night. Booking.com was good with their e-mail responses to make sure I could check-in after mid-night. Also they don't charge your card until check-in or no-show. The hotel located at the edge of the red-light district was quiet at the wee-hour in the morning, Taxi driver knew exactly the location just gave him the Lorong (lane) number (even numbers are in red-light district). Taxi fare from Changi SD26 not MRT after 10 p.m.. Make sure you have the print-out of your confirmation, hotel clerk seemed not be able to check you in by name. I was on the 5th floor overlooking low buildings so had a good view. It was quiet and I'd a good sleep. The room is basic, not too clean, and in much need of a new paint job. Air conditioning and shower worked well. There were huge piles of laundry and the end and along the hallway. Well, at least they do their laundry. Make sure you use your key to lock the door. Door doesn't lock by itself. It was different in the morning, raucous cased by a Chinese tour group was heard through the thin doors. I took off around the street corner for a great choice of cheap tasty foods especially noodles. Go local, breakfast at SD5. Because my bus ride via StarMart to Taiping, Malaysia, also booked online, was not till 10 p.m. I extended my stay till 6 p.m. for an additional SD35. They were very strict about exact check-out time. You'll get a warning call. The Aljunied MRT is about 10-15 minutes north and from there Kallang is only SD1 and 15 minutes away. There is a deposit of SD1 on the fare, however, you could reclaim the deposit when you return the card. The Golden Mile Complex bus terminal is another 10-15 walk from the Kallang MRT. They charged SD1 for 15 minutes of internet use and no other amenities are available. All in all a basic and economical (for Singpapore price) place for a layover stay.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying Receptionist!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dewi_Andra
Reviews.Content: Day 1 - Check in @ around 1600hrs. Female receptionist was polite & helpful. Went back to the hotel room @ 12 midnite. Day 2 - MALE receptionist called TWICE @ 12 pm sharp to inform us that is already check out time. He's so annoying!!! Don't expect much from this hotel. Its just a hotel in red light district area.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller64
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Singapore are expensive at best. However at $69 per night, you would hope for a little better then this..... Checked in, went up to the room. Room was made up, however was horrified to find urine on the toilet seat, no toilet paer, water all over the bathroom floor, used soap with pubic hairs sitting in the soap holder. Needless to say, I went back downstairs and asked for another room. Second room.... given the keys, went upstairs again, dragged my bag over to the next room, only to find it no better then the last. Fecal matter still in the toilet bowel, no toilet paper, no soap, water all over the floor. Went back downstairs, complained that the sanitary condition of the rooms were unacceptable. Just as I am voicing my dissatisfaction, a tour group of 20 people come into the building. The shift manager tells me that I will have to wait until she processes the check in of all the guests. Tells me to go back to my room and she will "come up to inspect" later. That is the last I heard from her. Given that it was late at night by that stage, and I had an early morning flight the next day, it was too late to be looking around for another hotel. My response would have otherwise been to leave immediately and demand a refund. This hotel is a disgrace and without a shadow of a doubt, go's down as the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but didn't worth even the price.”
Reviews.Author: piyo10
Reviews.Content: It cost us S$65 but didn't worth the price. The water pressure of the shower is really low. The sink was choked. The room was not cleaned enough and small. If you stay the hotel like it in Tokyo, you could pay less than S$30. However, the hotel could be better if, 1)They clean the room well. 2)They provide proper maintainance for the facilities. And, I am sure these two are not difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Don't risk it”
Reviews.Author: dongguantraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel few hours before my arrival and had a confirmation with it. When I arrived and was told they do not have my reservation, and they wanted me to pay the walk up rate which was 60 SGD. The front desk assure me that it will be taking care off once the Buddhist holiday was over, to my suprise when I returned to Hong Kong on my next leg of the trip I saw another charge on Citibank account, needless to say I wasn't happy. Service was terrible, what they tell you at the counter may not be what they are going to do with you bill! Don't give them you credit card again once you had a reservation through a third party. The bedding was filthy with stains, this is the only place I ever slept on my street cloth for hygenic reason. The shower or bathroom is like taking a shower in a third war countries, even the Indian traveler from India was digusted with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty horrible, go elsewhere if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: Evilunderlord
Reviews.Content: The welcome was dreadful, we booked with Asia rooms and had the confirmation on the iPhone but reception insisted we pay a dollar fifty to print this out in their reception?! Rooms where so small we couldn't put our bags down properly and the matress was rubber eek!!! Right next to a brothel. It is pretty convenient for the  MTR. There is a sign on reception saying it was a finalist in Asia hotels of the year , who could the other candidates have been?????!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the world...”
Reviews.Author: Virgoletta1975
Reviews.Content: Singapore was the 3rd stop of our round-the-world honey-moon. I chose this hotel for the price, but what you get is NOT what you see in the hotel's website. It is a hotel where rooms are rented daytime... We got there with a early morning flight and asked for our room, although was early morning we were ready to pay to sleep, and we were asked how many hours we would the room for!!!! I was laughing... and we paid ahead!!!! Once in the room we were astonished, the simpliest room ever, an air-bed!!! with 2 plain white cotton sheets... we were so tired that had a quick shower, using this kinda towels. My husband was nuts... At night we were using internet in the lobby and there was a certain number of gals going in and out of the hotel with different men! It was an experience! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone but single men!!! And if you coose it, bring some Amuchina with you!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: VFM_Hunter
Reviews.Content: Frangrance Ruby is an average 2 start hotel located at Lorong 20 in the red light area of Geylang in Singapore. Inspite of its location the hotel is pretty safe and has cameras everywhere. The ameneties are pretty ok with a TV, bath tub and tea/coffee maker in the room. But the rooms are very small and the bathroom's plastic door is cheap and a pain. I paid USD 40.00 per night which is pretty reasonable by Singapore standards. The hotel has a travel desk but misses a restuarant

Reviews.Title: “Awful but cheap”
Reviews.Author: AP_Russia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chosen as the cheapest one in Singapore (god, they have awful prices for everything!). As to the location, it's situated in the discrict of Geylang, the area of Chinese and Indian canteens and local prostitutes. So don't book this hotel for a romantic trip (except if you're short of money). At the same time this is the closest hotel to a metro station in Geylang. About 7-10 minutes walk. Rooms are tiny and stuffy. If you wash some of your clothes or get wet under a heavy rain, you'll have big problems with drying them. Interiors of rooms and common spaces are like in cheap brothel. The staff is not very hospitable but ok in general. No breakfast. So once again: book this hotel only in case you want to save money. Spending time inside the hotel and around it is strictly not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: TravellersRus4
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay at this hotel, you get a comfortable room in a good location. Stayed here for 4 nights with my wife after a long European trip (we had run out of money). Area is great in my opinion, lots of food stalls nearby, and while it maybe in the red light district, I never felt unsafe. Reception was friendly and helpful with directions, just don't expect bags to be carried or taxi's to be organised (taxi's drive by every minute out the front). It's a 8-10 minute walk to Aljuned station for the sky rail. Cost me 1 dollar to get to the centre of the city. Plenty to see and do around Geylang, but in my opinion, catch the sky train to the city, but always come back to Geylang for dinner (I never paid over $4.00 SIN for a good tasty meal). Anyone expecting the Hilton, don't saty here, if your happy with good value for money and great food minutes from your door, book here for your next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Well it was different”
Reviews.Author: Imsopov
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying in a hotel in an Asian country, and after only doing a bus tour of Singapore inbetween flights I was keen to stay a few nights. The hotel was booked by my friend and his mates for the asian AFL tournament that was held in Singapore. We had a room with 2 single beds they were pretty close to each other and the room was small overall although so was the prince compared to other hotels in singapore. The room did have some cable tv channels which was good for watching soccer when I got back at night. There were plenty of prostitutes all over Geyland, especially on the street in front of the hotel although we did not have any approach us like on the main street in Geylang. If you think the prostitutes will offend you then defiantly dont stay here it is a eye opener for Singapore. After hearing people always going on about how clean Singapore was they obviously stayed far away from Geylang. The location is far away from all the touristy places like Orchard road but is closer to the airport, depending on what you are looking to do in Singapore should really determine if you would like to stay here, If you are just looking for a cheap and nasty hotel to stay in and then go back to the airport in the morning then you will be fine here, but if you are looking to travel to places like Orchard Road then I would suggest spending a little more and getting a hotel closer, as a few taxi rides around will easily bump the price you have paid. The Hotel staff were very helpful though, gave us directions on where to go and how to get there etc, giving us and marking on the map.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: A traveller arriving at this hotel, which is eight minutes' walk from Aljunied MRT station, could be forgiven for thinking that because of the 'red light' district this would be a noisy stay. You cannot get lost as the streets are more or less on a grid: just walk south then west from the station, and find the 'lorong' (lane) which is actually just another street, albeit narrower than Geylang Road. It was easy to book at www.asiatravel.com, particularly compared with the good Changi Airport transit hotel where it can be difficult to secure a room. Whether I was simply tired after a flight I don't know, but after a quick checkin from an efficient male clerk I was asleep pretty fast. I only heard one door banging during the night which is better than some mid-city hotels that I have patronsied in other cities. The prostitutes on the street just stand there and do not bother passers-by. Nor do the numerous shopkeepers along Geylang Road, or their customers. I declined breakfast due to an early start for my flight. The bathroom in this hotel was tiny, and the bed hardly large. However for SGD$70 or so (the rate in March 2009 appears to have dropped further to SGD$60), the hotel was excellent value compared to the outrageous prices many Singaporean hotels charged, at least until the recession hit late in 2008. Given the area, I wouldn't recommend this Fragrance Hotel for families, but single Westerners of either sex would be safe here, perhaps to the surprise of lone female travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Different, but overall ok”
Reviews.Author: Redback
Reviews.Content: only a quick overnight stay with 4 of us. yes the area is full of working girls yes the room is mighty small yes the shower toilet is within an arms length of each other. but , must say it was clean, quiet and well worth the $75 sing we paid. Walking the streets around the hotel is very very busy with people but always felt safe. Picked the hotel via the net because of it's closeness to MRT, about 10 minute walk. Staff were good at front desk (that's all we saw) Area full of local food courts. Would stay again but dont expect the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good value See old Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ward1314
Reviews.Content: For singke travelers who want to get a good value for the money. Very cultural area with working girls. Lots of food places near by. I only saw two other anglos in the area. Felt safe and was treated nice. If you want the feel of old Singapore stay in this area. Staff was freindly and helpful. rooms basic and small.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel, strange location”
Reviews.Author: kateanddave
Reviews.Content: good hotel budget wise - clean and tidy however was not in the location as advertised and a long way from the city centre. No facility for food within the hotel and the area is full of prostitutes. I have to add theydid not bother us at all but not the place for a familiy or elderly people to stay. Overall budgetwise it was a good hotel but we had to catch a train into the city each day. If you are on a tight budget I would recommend this over the hostels as you would pay the same price and get nicer facilities. Hotel staff were friendly and fairly knowledgeable. Not recommended if you like to party as last train back is 11pm and 12 at weekends. otherwise a very expensive taxi ride!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: pel579
Reviews.Content: We were only there for a quick over night stay, but that was enough. we booked this place over the internet before we found trip advisor. we didn't have time to venture out but there didn't seem to be any major shopping centres in the area and it was a fair hike from the airport with our back packs and had your choice of street girls on the corners. pretty seedy and we found far better places to stay by looking through trip advisor for our return stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Revolting and Seedy!”
Reviews.Author: Tasco1
Reviews.Content: Okay so this place was very cheap and rated as a two star so my expectations weren't that high in the first place however they were certainly not exceeded. Thankfully I only was staying for one night as transferring through to London the next day, here was my experience. The hotel is situtated right in the middle of the red light district overlooking brothels and prostiitutes hanging around the streets shouting and talking loudly all through the night. I was a woman on my own, white, blonde and was advised by the taxi driver not to leave the hotel as I would be mistaken for a european prostitute. Upon arrival two men in the lobby were staring at me the whole time I was checking in and I was afraid they would follow me up and see which room I was in. The room: smelt, was damp and mouldy, pillows were so OLD and had yellow stains all over them which made my stomach turn. The sheets seems freshly laundered however had big greasy stains over them! There were hairs on the bed and there was only a top sheet with a revolting old brown bobbled blanket to put over you. The bathroom had no mini toiletries, just some old bright red liquid soap attached to the wall which was gross. The shower is stuck to the wall next to the toilet with no door or screen and so the water just goes all over the basin and toilet and everything in the bathroom gets wet. I am certain that this hotel is used by the prostitutes that hang around the street outside so the rooms are used for unsavoury purposes! No matter how cheap a hotel is, I don't mind if it is basic, all I ask is for a clean bed and pillows to sleep in and for the room to be clean. I would certainly NOT reccommend this place to stay. I did not feel safe here on my own as a woman and got up and left as soon as I woke up. NEVER AGAIN at the Hotel Fragrance Ruby!!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: bbixby
Reviews.Content: As of March 2008, I'd advise anybody booking to be careful. The area is great, lots of local color, and the hotel at first impression definitely delivers a lot of bang for the buck. The room service is great, staff is a bit cold but helpful, and the place looks well-kept. On day 3 of our 5 day stay however, we came home to find 3-5 baby cockroaches in our room. We had seen just one a day earlier and chose to ignore it, but this amount was ridiculous. We checked out immediately and were issued a refund through their Tokyo office promptly. It is a shame, and I hope they clean up their act a bit. The Geylang area is great, and far better than a tourist trap like Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Area”
Reviews.Author: STEVEFR
Reviews.Content: I choose this area to stay as arrived at Changi Airport at about 1AM without any Hotel reservation and knew that it was a short taxi ride away with a large number of budget Hotels. It served that purpose well but would not choose to stay here for any length of time unless on an absolute budget. The rooms are small and basic but clean. The area of the Hotel is very interesting, and whilst is the red light area it is so safe to walk around in busy streets at 3AM. The restaurants are incredibly busy even at that timeand this area has a good reputation for quality / local / budget food. MRT / Train to downtown or Changi airport is a shortish walk away but taxi costs are also moderate and trustworthy. This is not a tourist really a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “safe!”
Reviews.Author: Maartje
Reviews.Content: As our travel agent had made a mistake we had to stay in Singapore for 24 hours. They offered us a hotel which had terrible reviews here, so we demanded a better one, and got this. The rooms are tiny but clean, the staff are very friendly, the area is interesting. Although it's in the middle of the red light district, it is completely safe to walk there, even late at night, which we did with our children. Every Singaporean we met told us so, and we absolutely felt this was true. The good thing about this area is that the cheapest and best restaurants are found here, which we tested and had also heard from people living in Singapore. All in all, not a bad place to stay if you're on a budget. We did hear some noises in the corridor during the night and saw both school parties with really young children and prostitutes check in!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: mahraja786
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and was good for a comfortable night sleep. It is some distance from the city but there is a MRT (train) station within 10 minute walking distance. The MRT rivals the tube in London for its efficiency and is much cleaner and one can get to any destination in Singapore. The average fair is $1 USD. I traveled almost exclusively on the MRT and have no complaints. The area is filled with great local restaurants where you could eat all kinds of original Singapore cooking. The hotel was very cheap, about $25 USD per night. The hotel however is in the red-light district. It is very obvious from all the girls around. But the area is still safe. I could wander about the area at 12 am without being troubled nor did I ever feel like I was in any kind of danger. Do not expect any amenities as it is a very much just a room and board type hotel. People however were friendly and kept out of your way. The hotel in my opinion is great for a young budget-minded individual or a couple who don't mind walking and experiencing some of the less glamorous aspects of travel. For people who can't walk as much or for families this hotel is not the best of choices. But for $25 USD it was definitely worth it for me.

Reviews.Title: “OK Lah!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was gonna be bad but it turn out to be better than what i expected. Although the area is a bit famous for you-know-what.. but overall, the hotel is pretty safe and secure. Taxis are available outside the entrance of the hotel. It roughly below $10 sgd to get to orchard by cab. The price of the rooms are quite reasonable and cheap for this area. There are a few other hotels next to it for you to choose from. This hotel is better than staying in some backpackers hotel where you have to share with other people. So, personally, i would recommend it to those budget travellers who does not want to spend a lot on logging but still be satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: “Its worth it!”
Reviews.Author: currybaby
Reviews.Content: Suprisingly, the rooms are very clean for a budget hotel. Friendly staffs. Location might be a bit far from the town but its easy to grab a cab just outside the hotel. There are a few food stalls and shops just nearby the hotel. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty poor!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be good for travellers on a very tight budget, but just not worth it if you can afford that little bit extra. It was in the centre of the red light district and on the way to the hotel, the taxi driver warned me not to leave anything in any of the rooms. I asked about a safe on check-in and was told "no safe" by a receptionist in a suite which clearly hadn't seen a dry cleaners in months. The matress was an awful plastic thing and thank goodness I took a spare pillow case (good travelling tip) as they were filthy. The sheets were stained and I wondered exactly what this hotel is usually used for, considering its location. The first thing I had to do in the room was rid it of the cock roaches. Although clean, the bathroom was very dated and the shower over the bath was no where near tall enough. It's also miles out of the city. There is an MRT station close by, but it's one of those districts where you don't feel quite very safe and somewhere that you wouldn't really fancy exploring at night. This place is really only an alternative to a hostel.
